intro: Sclerostylis timoriensis, commonly known as the Timor screw-pine, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually greenish-white in color and appear in clusters. Sclerostylis timoriensis is an important species in its native habitat, contributing to local biodiversity and ecological balance.
